title: Mobile Microlearning Course for Developing Covariational Reasoning in Trigonometry: Focus on Graphs, Equations, and Variable Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental trigonometric concepts (period, amplitude, phase), experience in advanced graph interpretation, and foundational knowledge of calculus
context.additional_context: Learners study without spatiotemporal constraints using mobile devices, with daily 15-20 minute modules (graph analysis/equation-solving tasks). Real-time video sessions (2 sessions) focus on proof analysis, while asynchronous discussion boards share problem-solving strategies.

learning_goals: Using dynamic visualization tools (e.g., graphing calculators), learners can explain the relationships between trigonometric function variables as equation inference steps on coordinate systems.
Through a step-by-step task sequence (discrete data â†’ continuous functions), learners progress in their ability to infer periodicity, amplitude, and phase shifts in trigonometric functions.
Based on formative assessment feedback (problem-solving analysis), learners can reflect on and revise their reasoning processes (variable control, graph interpretation).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
